result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and OWI (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Scott H. Lee was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*   Pay fine of $400 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay surcharge.

supervisions.notes:
***AJOC - As per order signed on 5/3/19***
***Nunc pro tunc 11/14/14***

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  11:32am-  Defendant sentenced to WSP for 60 months: 30 months initial confinement & 30 months extended supervision w/ conditions - consecutive to revocation in 09CF563.  Court orders a $400.00 fine plus costs.  DE is not eligible for ERP.  DE is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  DE to submit DNA sample (unless previously done).  Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on November 14, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Attorney Edwards is requesting 9/5/2014 Sentencing hearing be rescheduled.  Attorney Edwards requested that the SPD's client services specialist collect information to present at sentencing to address some of the issues with the PSI & the report is not ready.  State does not object.  Sentencing hearing is rescheduled to 11/14/2014 at 10:30am.  NTBS by the Court.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  1:47pm-  Attorney Edwards is requesting an adjournment to look into some questions the DE has after reviewing the PSI.  State does not object.  Court grants request.  Sentencing hearing adjourned to September 5, 2014 at 10:30 am.  Bond continued.
AODA Counseling Report
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:17am-  Matter is resolved.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 2; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, count 1 is dismissed.  Parties request PSI be waived - denied by the Court.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Bond continued.
Due to time constraints, Court adjourns 6/12/2014 Final pre-trial to 6/13/2014 at 9am for a plea hearing.  Parties notified in court.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared by Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:12am-  State writted the DE from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Edwards advises the court that as of this morning the DE is now at Prairie du Chien.  Court adjourns matter to May 20, 2014 at 10:00 am to allow the DE to be present.  Bond continued.
